intro: Senecio parvocapitatus, commonly known as the small-headed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It features small, daisy-like yellow flowers surrounded by pale green bracts. Senecio parvocapitatus is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
